thread.title: Wichita Falls church sews, donates dozens of outfits for Cook Children's premature babies
thread.title_full: Wichita Falls church sews, donates dozens of outfits for Cook Children's premature babies

author: Natalie McCain
title: Wichita Falls church sews, donates dozens of outfits for Cook Children's premature babies
text:
KFDX Wichita Falls Wichita Falls church sews, donates dozens of outfits for Cook Children’s premature babies Natalie McCain Thu, December 26, 2024 at 7:58 PM UTC 1 min read
WICHITA FALLS ( KFDX/KJTL ) — Dozens of babies at the Cook Children’s NICU will have a cozier holiday, thanks to a local church.
Faith Village Church of Christ’s sewing team handcrafted dozens of baby clothes for premature infants spending their holidays in the hospital.
RELATED STORY: 3,000 Prayer Bears and counting: Mother-son duo take on year 7 of Cook Children’s donations
One of Cook Children’s chaplains, Rebecca Davis, said donations like this can make all the difference for parents, especially if they’re not expecting an extended stay at the NICU.
Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement “As you can imagine, a lot of families don’t prepare to have a premature baby,” Davis said. “And so they’re not really they don’t have a lot of clothes or outfits for the baby, except for what the hospital issued.”
For Davis, large, handcrafted donations like these provide comfort for the infants and the parents.
“When we’re able to present them with an outfit or blanket, families are usually super happy and excited,” Davis said. “They feel a little sense of, I want to say, home because it’s not what the hospital has given, but it’s been donated with love and care. And so we’re pretty excited about these little things.”
The local Albers family dropped off the handmade outfits to Cook’s during their seventh annual Prayer Bear drop off, donating 552 bears to the kids in the hospital.
